definition: to write on behalf of sb/to ghostwrite
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: I Tertius, who wrote this epistle, salute you in the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 我这代笔写信的德丢，在主里面问你们安。

sentences.english: How many books have you ghostwritten so far?
sentences.chinese: 到现在为止你给多少书代笔。

sentences.english: The speech of the director was ghosted.
sentences.chinese: 那名董事的演讲辞是别人代笔的。

sentences.english: So all the quotation marks suggest human voice.
sentences.chinese: 所以引号代笔了人类的声音。

sentences.english: They can also ghostwrite for you.
Eg: As a ghostwriter, he earned a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 他作为代笔人挣了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: Landscape seems his teacher, and more than its ghostwrite.
sentences.chinese: 山水似其师，并多为其代笔。

definition: to write as substitute for sb/a ghost writer/plagiarism
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
remuneration for literary or artistic work
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
writing up of official or judicial documents/pettifoggery
to write the title of a book on a label
to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
